text:
so for our next rice dish on the top of my list 
we're here at a nice dish sit-down restaurant

which is a little different because usually a 
family-style restaurant like this don't serve

single dish meal except for one thing and 
that is what we're having it's crab fried

rice or Khao pad Bowl now the reason why I 
chose crab as opposed to chicken or pork or

whatever is because crab is pretty much the 
most popular type of fried rice in Thailand

to the point where they're actually restaurants 
that specialize in just crab fried rice and that

is why it's the only fried rice for which 
I have a video at seafood restaurants like

this one they like to serve it as sort of you 
know the alternative to jasmine rice here we go

it's a really simple flavor it's a little salty 
and a little sweet but for what it is it does its

job well which is sort of the sort of mild 
and come free flavor and it goes well as a

side dish to other things now normally if you 
had this as a single dish meal they'll serve

it with bignum flour which is sort of the fish 
sauce and chili fundament and a wedge of wine

we don't have that here today because it's not 
it's supposed to be a side dish to everything

else and this one in particular has slices 
of tomatoes and onion which is not usual but

you know they every restaurant has its own 
variation so that's just kind of what they

do to make it a little more interesting 
so that is all for our craft right now

we are on our way to our next dish and we're 
going to a shopping mall to the food court now

before you freak out Thai food courts are not 
like American food courts they are not crappy

fast food chains they actually have a pretty good 
selection of Thai food and most of them will sell

what I call one dish meals so we're going to go 
to a place called a mall bangkapi which apparently

has a very good food court so here it is our 
cow Moo dang or literally translated as rice

with a red pork here's our red pork the red pork 
is basically Chinese barbecue pork that's been

roasted with a bunch of spices mostly cinnamon 
and star nice and the sauce is the best part of

this dish and it's like a gravy that is seasoned 
primarily with five-spice powder and soy sauce so

it's got kind of like a cinema nice sweet salty 
kind of flavor and often you can order ham oh

dang with also crispy pork belly Oh Moo grog and 
you know if you don't mind the animal fat and you

like something crispy it's a nice addition 
so now I'll try I'll try the mudang for you

really prominent cinnamon and star anise 
flavor it's really kid-friendly I remember

really liking this dish ask it so if you ever 
bring your Kitsch to Thailand this is a great

dish for them to have and its moist it's got 
a little bit of vegetables though it's not

all meat and yep this is our pal molding and of 
course you didn't think I was gonna finish this

series without a rice dessert did you and 
of course we're gonna have a rice pudding

today which is black sticky rice pudding now 
there's lots of different rice desserts that

I could talk about but this happens to be the 
one that I quite like very much and I've done

this recipe before a long time ago and it's 
very easy it's black sticky rice that's been

cooked with sugar until it's like this chewy 
sticky mess and it's custom cooked taro inside

and it's got a salty sweet coconut milk 
that gets poured on top served warm is

best a very very nice winter dessert even 
though it's never winter here in Thailand

black sticky rice has a very unique flavor 
it's not the sticky rice it's black so if

you get a chance make this recipe I 
promise promise you you will like it

and that concludes our top 5 rice dishes 
in Bangkok I hope you enjoy it if you want

to write me about any of this that have 
any questions feel free to do so through

my website Twitter Instagram Facebook and I 
will see you next time for your delicious meal
